Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2015 04:56PM bestauntever wrote: Ah. Okay. I guess nothing is very easy when it comes to this stuff. So I may end up with an MRI and I guess I just want it out of there. Now. Like everyone seems to say - it's all about waiting and seeing. I see that some people see the breast surgeon first and the onco second, but here, they do it the other way.
Posts.Title: I will be seeing the breast surgeon soon - what to expect? bestauntever Trvler

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2015 01:02AM bestauntever wrote: Thank you everyone for your kind words and good advice. I wish you good luck Kim, as well. Wish I had the rest of my biopsy report though.
Posts.Title: Got the news today and am trying to wrap my head around it bestauntever bestauntever

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2015 08:22PM bestauntever wrote: I'm in Michigan. The reg dr. (gp?) referred me to an oncologist and from there I guess I'm supposed to go through some tests - blood, ct scan, or mri, or pet, or bone and then see the breast surgeon. My sister asked her nurse and bc friends and they all said that's the protocol around here. The gp gave me some meds to help calm me down. I will ask the onco (I hate writing that. I will always hate writing that) when I see him/her on Tuesday what the plan is. Still waiting for someone to wake me up. Thank you for your replies.
